info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 22 at 5:20PM EDT until May 22 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR NELSON...SOUTHWESTERN ALBEMARLE AND SOUTHEASTERN AUGUSTA COUNTIES... At 520 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Afton to near Lowesville to near Amherst, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Sherando, Shipman, Schuyler, Wintergreen, Nellysford, Arrington, Scottsville, Esmont, Lovingston, Allens Creek, North Garden, Covesville, Tyro, Buffalo Springs, Norwood, Jonesboro, Gladstone, Faber, Massies Mill and Bryant. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
